name: CALLATER LODGE
about: Situated in the heart of the Cairngorms National Park, the historic village of Braemar boasts many traditional and long-standing buildings, including the newly renovated Callater Lodge. Standing proud in Spacious and attractive grounds the Victorian villa was built from local granite in 1861.Gordon Mitchell Contractors Ltd were contracted to renovate, extend and transform the 6 en-suite bedroom guest house into a high-end highland sporting lodge. While the house exudes a traditional country charm it is highly equipped with modern necessities as requested by the owner. From our past experiences in traditional country housing we were able to deliver on this effectively by integrating the past with the present.Upon completion the new lodge now hosts 8 en-suite bedrooms, a stunning bar and lounge area steeped in country tradition, a grand dining room, a beautiful bespoke kitchen that features Scottish oak trusses and an outdoor entertaining area all of which is accompanied by a new out-building containing a purpose built games room, office and dog kennel.
